intro: Bigelowia oppositifolia, commonly known as the New Zealand bellflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue and violet. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is known for its ornamental value. The flowers bloom in spring and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
